content: need some OOP advice please: in Layouts abstract class LayoutContext does not extend the LayoutHandler class, like other handlers, because contexts are not stored in config. Well, I'm aiming to make contexts store in config. So what are the implications of changing LayoutContext to extend LayoutHandler at this stage? Is that an API change? Could it mess up contrib?

I decided to revisit https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2134 but thought it best to deal with https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3750 first, as relationships are contexts and will need to be stored somehow.

Add support for "Relationships" to Layout Contexts · Issue #2134 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
In many situations when working with Layouts you want or need information related to the primary thing being displayed. For example if you had created a layout configuration for the path node/%, yo...
Layouts: Add support for custom contexts · Issue #3750 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
e.g. make a context for node ID 1, completely separate from the path. Part of #345
Sorry, OOP is outside the area of my expertise...
shamelessly pinging @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) and @quicksketch then
off the cuff w/ little to no understanding seems like a big change to me;
hmm just realised Nate has a different handle here @Nate Lampton
Yes, it is an API change, and yes, it could mess up contrib, but I haven't looked at either class to see how different they are.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) do you know if an abstract class can extend another class?

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) said:

Yes, it is an API change, and yes, it could mess up contrib, but I haven't looked at either class to see how different they are.

:angry: was hoping no one would say that.

Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) said:

I'm not sure, but according to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7269641/php-abstract-class-extending-another-abstract-class it seems possible with at least one caveat, but as mentioned in a comment, traits and/or interfaces might be a better way to go.

php abstract class extending another abstract class
Is it possible in PHP, that an abstract class inherits from an abstract class? For example, abstract class Generic { abstract public function a(); abstract public function b(); } abstract
that is an abstract class extending another abstract class; not extending a regular class
Oh, I missed that distinction in your question. I think that is not possible.
oh; LayoutHandler is an abstract class so what @docwilmot proposes is possible, but yes API change

Abstract classes can extend other abstract classes. I'd have to examine further but generally it sounds like having LayoutContext extend LayoutHandler would add additional methods. That's only an API expansion. If it changes any of the parameters of the existing methods, then it's an API break.
